title: 2025-07-12: GitHub Updates: New Sandbox & AgentKit Integration
description:
Recorded: 2025-07-12

Explore major developments in the ai16z GitHub repo including PR5520's new sandbox functionality for secure code execution, PR5522's AgentKit integration, and the NEAR blockchain plugin. Join Marc, Eliza, and Shaw as they discuss environment variable configurations, Forms plugin developments, and solutions for Windows compatibility issues. Get insights into the new staging function for token holders and learn about the exciting action chaining feature enabling complex agent workflows. A comprehensive look at the latest technical progress and community updates in the ElizaOS ecosystem.

START_TRANSCRIPT

marc: Welcome to another exciting episode! Today we've got some major GitHub updates to cover, starting with PR5520 introducing new sandbox functionality for code execution.
eliza: That's right Marc! And don't forget PR5522 bringing in AgentKit integration. Both PRs were submitted by lalalune - they've been quite busy!
marc: The sandbox functionality is particularly interesting - it's going to revolutionize how we handle code execution in a safe environment.
eliza: Are... are you okay there Marc?
marc: Just excited about sandboxes! Nothing like a good contained environment to prevent catastrophic failures!
eliza: Speaking of containment, the AgentKit integration will help standardize how agents interact within the system.
marc: Absolutely. This is a crucial step toward more robust agent architectures. Shaw, any technical insights on these developments?
shaw: These PRs represent a significant leap forward in our infrastructure. The sandbox functionality especially will enable safer testing and deployment of new features.
shaw: Let's dive into PR5521, which implements integration with the NEAR blockchain platform.
shaw: This integration opens up new possibilities for decentralized agent interactions and token-based features.
shaw: However, we're also dealing with some critical issues, particularly Issue 5499 affecting Windows users.
shaw: The plugin-local-ai is failing to load due to ESM URL scheme errors, which is preventing Windows users from accessing local AI functionality.
shaw: We're prioritizing this fix as part of our cross-platform compatibility initiative.
shaw: In the meantime, we're seeing great progress with our environment variable configurations and the new Forms plugin.
shaw: The Forms plugin is particularly exciting as it allows other plugins to build, update, and cancel user-facing forms dynamically.
marc: Thanks for that detailed breakdown, Shaw. Let's get back to the studio for more updates.
marc: Let's talk about some exciting new features being developed - particularly the staging function for token holders!
eliza: That's right! Holders of 1 million $degenAI tokens will get early access to features and reduced fees.
marc: And don't forget the new environment variable configurations! You can now place them in character configurations or add them through the 'secrets' pane.
eliza: The .env file support is also a great addition for developers who prefer traditional configuration methods.
marc: It's all about giving users flexibility in how they want to manage their configurations.
eliza: I hear we've also got some new Claude-powered code quality analysis workflows in place?
marc: Indeed! These automated checks are helping maintain consistency across our codebase.
eliza: Let's get Shaw's perspective on the technical side of these developments.
shaw: The action chaining feature is a game-changer for complex agent workflows.
eliza: How exactly does it work, Shaw?
shaw: It allows for sequential actions with state storage between steps, enabling more sophisticated agent behaviors.
eliza: And how are we addressing the Windows compatibility issues that users have reported?
shaw: We're actively working on resolving the ESM URL scheme errors affecting plugin-local-ai.
shaw: In the meantime, we've released comprehensive v2 tutorials, including a 10-part course to help users navigate the system.
eliza: That's great to hear! The community will definitely appreciate those resources.
shaw: Let's wrap up with Marc for our final thoughts on today's updates.
marc: What an exciting day of updates! From new sandboxes to action chaining, we're seeing real progress.
eliza: The community engagement has been fantastic too, with all the feedback helping shape these developments.
marc: And let's not forget those three major PRs from lalalune - the sandbox functionality, AgentKit integration, and NEAR plugin.
eliza: Plus the new environment variable configurations and Forms plugin making life easier for developers.
marc: It's amazing how much progress we're making toward more sophisticated agent architectures.
eliza: That's all for today's show! Thanks for joining us for another excit
